description.narrative: By 2016, high quality quantitative and qualitative evidence generated for advocacy for child rights., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Economic And Social Policy General, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Knowledge on the situation and rights of children among stakeholders and duty â€“bearers generated to guide implementation of CRC, policy formulation, social sectors' strategies and budget allocations for increased social spending on national programmes that improve realization of the rights of children within the lowest wealth quintile.

description.narrative: Coverage levels of basic social services effectively measured by Bangladesh Bureau of Statistics, with UNICEF support, with data collected from over 200,000 households using Tablet PCs and data management through web based technology.
